p: This review discusses unresolved issues in our understanding of infectious diseases and SARS-CoV-2 infection and possible mechanisms of acute organ cell injury in COVID-19 are discussed through the lens of the protein-homeostasis-system (PHS) hypothesis. Given that uncontrolled extensive immune reactions may be a leading cause of COVID-19 fatalities, a rationale for early immune-modulator treatment is presented for clinicians concerned about the potential complications of corticosteroid treatment in older patients with underlying conditions.
